page.syntax: Processed_Dialog as P = a5_XdialogPreProcess(C dlg_string [,C default_body_tags [,C style_sheet ]])

argument.name: Processed_Dialog
argument.description: Contains two properties: .dlg_body = processed Xdialog .dlg_event = additional event handling code

argument.name: dlg_string
argument.description: Beginning definition of the Xdialog with embedded help tags.

argument.name: default_body_tags
argument.description: Specifies any default parameters, such as background color, for the window.

argument.name: style_sheet
argument.description: Specifies a CSS style sheet that can be referenced by your help text.

page.description: Used to pre-process an Xdialog body string to replace labels that have the format ##label!helptopic~~ with the appropriate Xdialog code
page.discussion: The A5_XdialogPreProcess() function replaces tags with the format ##Label!variable_name~~ with the appropriate help text. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

see.ref: Displaying Dynamic Help When Clicking on a Label
